name: Avoid Unused Validation Form in Struts 1.x
description:
An unused validation form indicates that validation logic is not up-to-date.

This rule will check that each validation form defined in validation.xml correspends to a specified form-bean. If not it gives the violation.

This check is done when used used struts version is 1.x
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Primary and Secondary Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale:
An unused validation form indicates that validation logic is not up-to-date.
It is easy for developers to forget to update validation logic when they remove or rename action form mappings. One indication that validation logic is not being properly maintained is the presence of an unused validation form.
